ext_description.p:
A Structured_text is a type of
that may have identifiable relations between itself and other portions of the . Those relations are a container relationship in which the Structured_text is "contained in" an , or a sequential relationship in which the Structured_text may be in a specific sequence of Structured_text within an . Structured_text may be composed of other instances of Structured_text or as content, in a tree structure. A Structured_text shall be acyclic. The Structured_text should at least provide content at the lowest level of the structure.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 is exchanging the content of a document, not its presentation format.
ext_description.example: An example of Structured_text is an extract from an in SGML, in which each portion of the has a known structure.
Structured_text objects can be chapters, titles, paragraphs, sentences or structured markup.

ext_description.p: the structured_text_content specifies the role of the Structured_text for the Structured_text. There may be one or more entries in the structured_text_content for a particular Structured_text. The structured_text_content need not be provided for the Structured_text.
ext_description.note: structured_text_content would only not be provided if there was no need to specify lower level markup within the current markup or if plain_text_content were provided.

ext_description.p: the precedent_structured_text specifies the role of the Structured_text for the Structured_text. This role is appropriate when both Structured_text are helping to compose a higher level Structured_text or are referenced by an . The precedent_structured_text need not be provided for a Structured_text.
ext_description.note: precedent_structured_text is provided to ensure the correct sequencing of text contents.

ext_description.p: the plain_text_content specifies the role of the for the Structured_text. The plain_text_content need not be provided for the Structured_text.
ext_description.note: plain_text_content would only not be provided if there was a need to specify lower level markup within the current markup.

ext_description.p: A Structured_text_id_in_document is a set of detailed information whose location in a document is directly referenced. The information is in the form of text, tables, and graphics in a human readable language, although the hard copy may be a report from computer interpretable files. The same information may be included in multiple documents in different locations, and in that case different Structured_text_id_in_document would be populated for each document. This Application Object supports the case where it is necessary to identify the different locations within the same document that a set of information exists.

the identifier and document shall be unique within a population of the Structured_text_id_in_document.
